Docs.summary: Provides a base implementation for a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage> class is a complete implementation for a component editor page that consists of an empty window. You can extend this page to add your own controls. <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage> is used by a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorForm> of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.WindowsFormsComponentEditor>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates an example <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage> implementation.
[!code-cpp[ComponentEditorExample#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ComponentEditorExample/CPP/componenteditorexamplecomponent.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[ComponentEditorExample#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ComponentEditorExample/CS/componenteditorexamplecomponent.cs#6)] [!code-vb[ComponentEditorExample#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/ComponentEditorExample/VB/componenteditorexamplecomponent.vb#6)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void EnterLoadingMode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Increments the loading counter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each procedure that performs loading or initialization should first call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.EnterLoadingMode%2A> method to indicate that it will load something before the editor can display the loaded editor page. When a loading procedure that called <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.EnterLoadingMode%2A> completes, it should call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.ExitLoadingMode%2A> method to indicate that its part of the load process is completed.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.Loading%2A> property is used as a counter to determine when loading is complete. A page is in loading mode if the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.Loading%2A> property is non-zero.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance void ExitLoadingMode() cil managed

Docs.summary: Decrements the loading counter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each procedure that performs loading or initialization should first call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.EnterLoadingMode%2A> method to indicate that it will load something before the editor can display the loaded editor page. When a loading procedure that called <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.EnterLoadingMode%2A> completes, it should call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.ExitLoadingMode%2A> method to indicate that its part of the load process is completed.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.Loading%2A> property is used as a counter to determine when loading is complete. A page is in loading mode if the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.Loading%2A> property is non-zero.

Docs.summary: Processes messages that could be handled by the page.
Docs.returns: if the page processed the message; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method gives the page a chance to process messages before the caller uses them. If this returns `true`, the message will be consumed; otherwise, the caller will continue to process the message.

Docs.summary: Indicates how many load dependencies remain until loading has been completed.
Docs.value: The number of remaining load dependencies.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is used to track the number of loading stages remaining. For each process needed to completely load the document, this counter is incremented before loading begins, and decremented when each loading process completes.

Docs.summary: Shows Help information if the page supports Help information.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This is only called if <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.SupportsHelp%2A> returns `true`. The Help system calls the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.ShowHelp%2A> method to provide Help for the page. <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Design.ComponentEditorPage.ShowHelp%2A> is usually called in response to F1 or when the Help button is clicked to allow the page to bring up its associated Help topic.
